ftbquests.chapter.bcomputer_craft.quest1: The &cComputer&r is the &amain&r block of &bComputerCraft&r. From the &cComputer&r, you will be able to make &dprograms&r, turn &eon&r and &off&r &bRedstone&r, use &bRednet&r, play &bgames&r, and much more. The &cComputer&r runs an &aOS&r called &bCraftOS&r.

&aAdvanced Turtles&r have the ability to &aplace&r, &bbreak&r, and &bdetect&r &eblocks&r, &bmove&r around and &ddrop&r &eitems&r in their &cinventory&r via their access to the &6Turtle API&r. The &6programs&r they run are stored in their &cinternal memory&r.
ftbquests.chapter.bcomputer_craft.quest2: The &6Computer&r (&7pictured&r) is the &amain&r block of &bComputerCraft&r. From the &6Computer&r, you will be able to make &dprograms&r, turn &eon&r and &off&r &cRedstone&r, use &cRednet&r, play &egames&r, and much more. The &6Computer&r runs an &eOS&r called &bCraftOS&r. &6Computers&r, &6Advanced Computers&r, and &6Command Computers&r have a &aresolution&r of &e51 pixels/characters horizontally&r by &e19 pixels/characters vertically&r.

&6ComputerCraft&r is a &amodification&r for &bMinecraft&r thatâ€™s all about &ccomputer programming&r. It allows you to build &ein-game Computers&r and &dTurtle Robots&r, and write programs for them using the &9Lua programming language&r.
The &cMonitor&r is a &cblock&r that can display &etext&r on its &cfront side&r. When several &cscreen blocks&r are placed on the same &cplane&r, it will form a single &cmonitor&r.
The &cAdvanced Monitor&r is a &cMonitor&r that has &emouse (as 'punches') support&r and can use the &aColor API&r for &escreen colors&r.

- &6Wired Modems&r are blocks which can be used to transfer data between &6computers&r, using the &cRednet API&r or the &cModem API&r. To place a &6modem&r on a side of a &6computer&r, right-click to place the &6modem&r while &esneaking&r.

- &6Wireless Modems&r are blocks which can be used to wirelessly transfer data between &6Computers&r and &aTurtles&r, using the &cRednet API&r or the &cModem API&r. To place a &6modem&r on a side of a &6computer&r, right-click while &esneaking&r.

- &5Ender Modems&r are &6advanced versions&r of the &6Wireless Modem&r. They use the same &cModem API&r, but are capable of &ccross-dimensional transmissions&r. They have an &aextreme range&r, capable of functioning across &adistances of up to 2,147,483,647 blocks&r (2^31-1, &6unaffected by height or weather&r), and are compatible with &6regular Wireless Modem signals&r.

&6Disk Drive&r is an &eobject&r that, when placed &cadjacently&r but not &cdiagonally&r next to a &6computer&r, does the same as a &cdisk drive&r for &6real computers&r in the &6real world&r would do: &9Pocket Computers&r can also be inserted into &6disk drives&r.
ftbquests.chapter.bcomputer_craft.quest3: &aTurtles&r have the ability to &aplace&r, &bbreak&r, and &bdetect&r &eblocks&r, &bmove&r around and &ddrop&r &eitems&r in their &cinventory&r via their access to the &6Turtle API&r. The &6programs&r they run are stored in their &cinternal memory&r.
ftbquests.chapter.bcomputer_craft.title: &3Computer &cCraft

ftbquests.chapter.bruh.quest11.descripti: &6Fluid Pipes&r are blocks used to transport and deal with &6fluids&r.

Normal pipes laid parallel to each other will automatically connect. &6Fluid Pipes&r can be adjacent without connecting if they have been made transparent with a &6Wrench&r, are encased with &6Copper Casing&r, or have a &6Wooden&r or &6Metal Bracket&r. Unlike &6Brackets&r or &6windowed pipes&r, &6Copper Casing&r can be placed on the corners of &6Fluid Pipes&r , locking the pipe in place and preventing it from connecting to more adjacent pipes.

&6Fluid Pipes&r can only move one liquid at a time; if different liquids intersect, the pipe will clog. Clogging the pipe will give an &6Advancement&r. Each time a fluid network splits, the fluid transfer rate is split between outputs. &6Fluid Pipes&r require &6Mechanical Pumps&r to move liquid.

&6Mechanical Pumps&r have a maximum range of 16 blocks on either side, adjustable in the Config. &6Mechanical Pumps&r will move fluid in only one direction at a time. &6Brown arrow symbols&r on the pump indicate the direction of flow. The flow direction can be changed by using a &6Wrench&r. When a wrench is used, the entire valve will appear to have rotated 180 degrees. The &6brown directional arrows&r will appear on the other side of the pump's gear.

Thin Air introduces air mechanics, making it harder and harder to breath the further you move away from the world's sea level. Both adventuring in caves as well as climbing tall moutains have suddently become quite dangerous if you don't bring a sufficient air supply! This only affects the Overworld for now. Check the Thin Air \& Cold Sweat Questsline.

Cold Sweat adds a temprature mechanic to the game. Do not worry, it has been configured to be easy to deal with. It is in Celsuis so make sure to check your temperature bottom left and not make it go below 10 degrees or above 40 degrees.
Check the Thin Air \& Cold Sweat Questlines.
Tempad adds a small tablet device with the ability to save locations and teleport to them from anywhere on the Sacred Timeline. This is the SteamPunk way of Teleporting. No more waystones!
Improvable Skills allows the players to upgrade themselves using experience and aquire new Skills and Abilities to add to their Book of Skills.

Scorched Guns is a new and exciting weapon mod with a unique vision. All can be highly customised to create your own unique variant. Using attachments and enchantments, you can increase the stats of a weapon to create an even more powerful version.

Create: Missions is a Create addon focused for Create mod servers. It will also work in singleplayers worlds, but it's designed to bring an economy throughout a server's lifetime. Encouraging players to build their own shop contraptions/exchange banks/banks. It works by giving 10 random missions per player per week. These missions can be vanilla missions like "Break X Veridium" or Create mod related like "Drive a train for 4 km with at least 2 passengers". You can also reroll the missions, and claim prices by completing them. Open the mission GUI pressing H key (by default) or using /missions command
Make sure to quickly look through the other quests and also complete those checkmarks before you begin playing.
All controls can easily be found in the Controls Settings menu with search options.
If are unsure about a Mod or Quest then either look up the Mod and check out the projects page or join the Luna Pixel Studios Discord! &blunapixel.studio/discord

ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest10.sub: &eSentry Boots&r are currently &cbugged&r and do not function properly at all. They are supposed to give full immunity to &9Zephyr attacks&r (damage and all) as well as grant complete &afall-damage resistance&r.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest12.sub: &8Silver Dungeons&r are located within structures resembling a &aparthenon&r in the sky. These have multiple floors, typically three, each with multiple rooms. Most rooms have chests inside them, and while the majority of the chests are fake (&cMimics&r), others contain some items. Silver Dungeons are inhabited by &9Valkyries&r, which only attack when the player attacks them. When playing on Peaceful, Valkyries still appear, but will teleport away when the player tries to attack them. Killing a &9Valkyrie&r yields a single &aVictory Medal&r. The boss of this dungeon can only be attacked by presenting it with &a10 Victory Medals&r, which can be done by right-clicking on it with the &aVictory Medals&r in hand. The &aSilver Dungeon boss&r can be attacked with any weapon.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest13.sub: &6Gold Dungeons&r are located within spherical islands with lots of &eGolden Oak&r trees growing on top of them. This dungeon normally will only have the &c&lboss room&r&r in it, with no treasure/mob rooms beforehand. The &eSun Spirit&r cannot be killed by attacking it directly and must be killed by hitting the &fwhite object&r he throws back at it multiple times. Every time it is hit with the white object, it sends out a smaller version of itself to attack the player. Once the player kills the &eSun Spirit&r, the sun will finally set in the Aether. Before the player kills the Sun Spirit, the sun will never go down. If the player fails to kill the &eSun Spirit&r, their spawnpoint will be reset over &clava&r, forcing the player to delete the map.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest15.sub: Allows the player to move up one-block high ledges without &ajumping&r.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest16.sub: &eValkyries&r are &eneutral mobs&r who prove themselves through battle. They will not attack unless provoked, and are found only in &8Silver Dungeons&r
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest17.sub: &6The Valkyrie Queen&r is a boss found in the &8Silver Dungeon&r.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest19.sub: &fHoly Swords&r are claimed to do &cincreased damage&r to &cundead enemies&r but they are &cbugged&r in the latest version and do not function properly.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest2.subt: &eBronze Dungeons&r have entrances that are located on the sides of normal islands. Bronze dungeons can have a varying number of rooms. Non-boss rooms contain &c&lsentries&r&r which attack the player, and sometimes have chests on 4x4 tables. Some of these chests are &cMimics&r, however. The &9boss&r of this dungeon can't be attacked with a sword. He can, however, take damage from any tool (&apickaxe&r, &ashovel&r, etc.). &c9 blocks&r on the floor of each antechamber aren't minable at all. The &cboss room's&r walls are only minable once the &cboss&r is dead.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest20.sub: Mobs attacked with a &eLightning Sword&r will be struck by &bthunder&r, which will create &9Coldfire&r wherever it lands. The lightning that the sword summons will also not hit you, although any fire that the lightning leaves behind will hit you, and if you stand on it long enough, catch you on &cfire&r.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest21.sub: &9Valkyrie Armor&r allows the player to fly in mid-air by holding &bspace&r but also additionally grants &afall-damage immunity&r and &aslow fall&r. Note that, like all the other gloves, &9Valkyrie Gloves&r cannot lose durability.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest22.sub: &bNeptune Armor&r allows the player to move at normal speed in water (even if in one-block deep water) when the full set is worn as well as to make full jumps out of one-block deep water. Note that, like all the other gloves, &bNeptune Gloves&r cannot lose durability
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest23.sub: When equipped, it will passively &aregenerate health&r at a half-heart every five seconds. The effect does not stack with two stones.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest24.sub: The &7Invisibility Cloak&r is a common loot item obtained from &aSilver Dungeons&r after defeating the &5Valkyrie Queen&r. When worn, the player wearing the cape will be unseen to &fplayers&r and &fmobs&r

The Sun Spirit drops the Sun Altar upon death, as well as the &eGold Key&r. The Sun Altar allows the user to control the time in the &aAether&r, with the &9GUI&r being opened by right-clicking the Sun Altar after placing it. The player can slide a sl...

ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest32.sub: &cPig&r and &6Zombie Pigmen&r mobs attacked with a &dPig Slayer&r will take &cincreased damage&r, enough to do &c1-hit kills&r to most &cPig&r and &6Zombie Pigmen&r mobs without armor.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest33.sub: &6Phoenix Armor&r grants full resistance to both &clava&r and &cfire&r when worn.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest34.sub: It cannot be crafted with &cObsidian&r, and must be crafted from &ePhoenix Armor&r and &bIcestone&r.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest35.sub: When equipped, it will allow permanent &9breathing&r &bunderwater&r.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest36.sub: When consumed, it increases your maximum health by one &cheart&r but will make it appear as if you are being damaged.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest37.sub: A &6Book of Lore&r could be read by right-clicking with the book in hand, and then players would view an open book stating the volume and the world the volume refers to. Underneath the title, there would be a slot where players can place any item native to that world. Once placed in the slot, the book would display information about the item. Each &6Book of Lore&r would only display information about their native items
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest38.sub: The &bFreezer&r allowed you to place certain items such as &erings&r and &ependants&r and then freeze them into &6ice versions&r of the item.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest4.subt: &9Valkyrie Lances&r have extended reach, so their melee range is &a10 blocks&r. This makes it technically a quasi-ranged weapon, due to its long reach.Left-clicking while holding a sword will do damage to both &bmobs&r and &9players&r, more so than if by bare hand. Upon damaging a mob or player, &9Valkyrie Lance's&r durability is decreased by one.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest42.sub: When eaten, it gives the &9Absorption&r and &aRegeneration&r buffs, respectively two minutes and 30 seconds.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest44.sub: Smelted Gravitite Ore. The ore falls up and is found at the bottom of Aether Islands.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest5.subt: Left-clicking makes the &cknife&r function like a melee weapon but right-clicking will throw and consume it. Throwing a knife will spawn &elightning&r, which will also spawn &9Coldfire&r.

Upon damaging a mob or player, &cFlaming Sword's&r durability is decreased by one.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest7.subt: The &aPhoenix Bow&r is found in &6Bronze Dungeon Chests&r. It shoots &cflaming arrows&r (And the text is green) and, unlike the &cVanilla Minecraft's bow&r, this one is not craftable. When you shoot the arrows it will not damage the bow. If the arrow hits the ground, it will be set on &efire&r.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.quest9.subt: When right-clicked, it summons two &bCloud Guardians&r who fly beside your head. Every time you right-click, the Guardians will each fire an &9ice ball&r at your target, doing &c2.5 hearts of damage&r per ice ball. The &bCloud Staff&r can be used &a61 times&r before breaking.
ftbquests.chapter.the_aether.title: &eThe Aether
ftbquests.chapter.thin_air__cold_sweat.q: You'll need the items above to set this up.
&bBreathe easier

&bCreate&r provides a handy diving &bhelmet&r and &bscuba tank&r that will also work to keep you alive down in the dark or on top of a mountain. It's a very easy setup and this &cquest line&r will guide you through it.&r
Below &cY=0&r and above &cY=128&r, you'll slowly start running out of air. There is a solution however..&r
Craft a &7Respirator
1.  Dig a &e3x3 hole&r somewhere and place the &bwaterwheel&r face down in the center.&r
2.  Replace one of the &9corner blocks&r and empty your &3water bucket&r against this block. The wheel should start turning (direction doesn't matter).&r
3.  Place a &a&lshaft&r in the center of the wheel and place the &e&llarge cog&r on top of that shaft.&r
4.  Place the &e&lsmall cog&r against the &e&llarge cog&r. It might take some careful aiming, but you'll see it as a ghost when positioned correctly.&r
5.  At this point, everything should be spinning. You can now connect the &ebacktank&r underneath the &esmall cog&r and you'll see it start to suck air in.&r
Thats it! The &bTank&r will last you 15 minutes. Can be enchanted with &6Capacity 3&r which allows 30 mins of air.&r
The tank can only be charged with a &a&lshaft&r connecting to the top. It doesn't matter which way it rotates.&r
Obtain a &6Copper Backtank

The front of the block will appear &e&llit&r when valid fuel has been given, similar to a furnace; however, the &c&lBoiler&r only drains fuel if it is actively warming up one or more &e&lWaterskins&r, and will stop once they all reach their maximum temperature of &e&l48 Â°C&r.&r
The &cBoiler&r is a technical block that is used to heat up &eWaterskins&r (9 Max). It accepts &fCoal, Charcoal, Coal Blocks, Magma Blocks, and Lava&r as fuel.&r
Craft a &4Boiler

When supplied with valid fuel, the &bIcebox&r will emit particles and show icicles forming on its sides. The Icebox only drains fuel if it is actively cooling down one or more &eWaterskins&r, and will stop once they all reach their minimum temperature of &e21 Â°C&r.&r
The &bIcebox&r is a technical block that is used to cool down &eWaterskins&r (9 Max). It accepts &fSnowballs, Snow, Water, Ice, and Packed Ice&r as fuel.&r
Craft a &bIcebox
The &dSoulfire Lamp&r is an item that cools down a 9x9 area around the player. The lamp only activates when the player is in &cdeadly heat in the Nether.&r
It is fueled by &dSoul Sprouts&r that you can grow on &7soulsand/soil&r. It thrives in hot biomes and temperatures, easiest way to grow is to place &c&llava&r by it.&r

The rate of fuel consumption depends on how high the world temperature is above the player's maximum threshold. This can be anywhere from 6 to 18 fuel per minute. Each sprout increasing the lamp's fuel by 4 which means 16 soul sprouts can completely fuel an empty soulspring lamp.
Used to mitigate the heat in the &cNether&r.&r
Craft a &3Soulspring Lamp
To use them, &a&lright-click&r with it in your hand to pour its water over yourself. This will instantly change the player's body temperature depending on the temperature of the &eWaterskin&r.
Alternatively, the player can keep a &eWaterskin&r in their hotbar to allow it to passively diffuse its temperature.&r This method is much slower, but does not consume its water.
These are best for quick outings. To prep them, they must first be filled with water at any water source, then put into an &bIcebox&r or &cBoiler&r.&r
Craft a &6Waterskin

The hearth requires shelter (as in a enclosed room) and appropriate fuel, such as coal and lava for cold environments, and snowballs, water, and ice for hot climates. Liquid lava and water can be piped into the side of the block for automation.

Its area-of-effect spreads from the block's location, passing through all non-solid surfaces and filling the room. A solid surface is defined as any face of a block's hitbox that covers the entire 16x16 area. The hearth can affect up to 12,000 blocks within a range of 96 blocks.

Upon placement and fueling, it gradually warms up, providing nearby players with the Insulated effect, reducing the impact of extreme temperatures. This effect maxes out at level 10 and expires once players leave the hearth's radius.

In a more permanent solution, like a base or outpost, a &c&lhearth&r is a more apt solution to stave off the elements. In the long run, it is much less &2&loperate&r and does not have to be constantly monitored.
Craft a &7Hearth
Molt&r can be dropped from &aChameleons&r around once per day. Found in &2jungle&r and &edeserts&r among other similar biomes.
Goats&r can be sheared and regrow their wool in about a day. They can be found in &2snowy peaks&r, &2stony peaks&r, and spawn among other similar biomes.

The &c&lSewing Table&r is a crafting station that is used to combine any piece of armor with the temperature-resistant effects of &d&lleather&r, &a&lchameleon molt&r, &6&lhoglin skin/rabbit hide&r, or &b&lgoat fur/wool&r. This allows the armor to provide &dneutral&r, &aadaptive&r, &6heat&r, or &bcold&r mitigation, respectively.
Craft a &cSewing Table
